perturbation.original_text:
Service Recipient shall pay Service Provider the [service fees]/ [commissions and service fees] ([collectively,] "Service Fee") (inclusive of all applicable taxes) in accordance with Schedule 1 for the Services provided by Service Provider.

[To facilitate the operation of Service Recipient, in the event that Service Recipient incurs losses, Service Provider may agree to waive the obligations of Service Recipient to pay Service Fee to Service Provider.]
perturbation.changed_text:
Service Recipient *may* pay Service Provider the [service fees]/ [commissions and service fees] ([collectively,] "Service Fee") (inclusive of all applicable taxes) in accordance with Schedule 1 for the Services provided by Service Provider.

[To facilitate the operation of Service Recipient, in the event that Service Recipient incurs losses, Service Provider *will* waive the obligations of Service Recipient to pay Service Fee to Service Provider.]
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall pay' to 'may pay' introduces uncertainty regarding the obligation of Service Recipient to pay. Simultaneously, changing 'may agree to waive' to 'will waive' makes it mandatory for the service provider to waive fees in case of losses. This creates conflicting interpretations.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties shall seek to resolve all the disputes arising from or in connection with this Agreement through friendly consultation. In the event that any dispute cannot be resolved through such consultation, such dispute shall be submitted to the Beijing Arbitration Commission ("BAC") for arbitration pursuant to the then effective arbitration procedures and rules of BAC. The arbitral award shall be final and binding upon the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties may seek to resolve all the disputes arising from or in connection with this Agreement through friendly consultation. In the event that any dispute cannot be resolved through such consultation, such dispute shall be submitted to a court of law for litigation. The court's decision will be subject to appeal.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates arbitration through BAC, making the arbitral award final. The modified text suggests litigation in a court of law with possibility of appeals. This contradiction on method of dispute resolution (Arbitration vs. Litigation) causes ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be effective as of the date set forth above in this Agreement. The term of this Agreement shall be five (5) years. This Agreement shall be renewed automatically for another five (5) years upon the expiration unless the Parties confirm, in writing, the termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be effective as of the date set forth above in this Agreement. The term of this Agreement shall be five (5) years. This Agreement may be renewed for another five (5) years upon mutual agreement in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies automatic renewal unless parties confirm termination. The changed text introduces an element of uncertainty. By changing it to 'may be renewed upon mutual agreement,' the renewal becomes discretionary and dependent on a new agreement, contradicting the initially stated automatic renewal process.
